body:
Hi:
i'm hoping what i want to achieve with environments is possible, given the way  LMOD works.
One of the environments I want to do is based on gcc7, 
is there a way to have the spack env command switch LMOD's env var of MODULEPATH so that the root of people's module tree changes depending on the environment?

in essence, i wanted people to see nothing, unless they activated an environment,
and then only 'see' what's in that environment.... or is there some other pattern,
possibly using views, where this is possible?  

I have some users that want everything, and then some who want a minimalist version,
and then i want to be able to test side by side in the same 'release' versions of packages compiled with different compilers, and have some isolation between the environments, without them having different spack roots. thanks!
title: Feature Request: Allow environments to modify MODULEPATH (like adding environment to LMOD hierarchy)
